events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection involving rear-end collision with minimal injuries.
Claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in the collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the investigation and communication with the claimant regarding the car accident.
The claim has been officially acknowledged and the insured was informed about the next steps to provide accident details and documentation.
The agent requested submission of the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to process the claim.
All requested documents including the police report and vehicle damage photos were submitted promptly by the claimant.
An investigation was initiated to verify details of the accident and assess liability based on provided evidence and witness statements.
The investigation concluded confirming that the insured was not at fault, and damages were consistent with the accident description.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering repairs and associated costs based on the damage assessment.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and fair settlement proposal made by the insurance company.
The claim was officially approved after confirming all documents were complete and the settlement terms agreed upon.
Payment for the settlement amount was issued to the insured’s designated account promptly as agreed.
The claim was closed successfully following completion of payment and resolution of the insured’s vehicle repairs.
All claim files and digital records were securely archived for future reference as per company protocols.
